info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:07PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Berks County through 545 PM EDT... At 507 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Laureldale, or near Reading, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reading, Wyomissing, Kutztown, Fleetwood, Laureldale, Leesport, Lyons, Fairview Hgts, Spring Ridge, West Reading and Wyomissing Hills. This includes Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 38 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
